', 'Custom SQLite functions written in Python for ranking documents indexed using the FTS4 extension.', 'Read ', ' for further details on this project.', 'You can try out these SQL functions ', '.', 'This module implements several custom SQLite3 functions. You can register them against an existing SQLite connection like so:', 'If you only want a subset of the functions registered you can do so like this:', 'if you want to use these functions with ', ' you can enable them by installing the ', ' plugin:', 'This is an extremely simple ranking function, based on ', ' in the SQLite documentation. It generates a score for each document using the sum of the score for each column. The score for each column is calculated as the number of search matches in that column divided by the number of search matches for every column in the index - a classic ', ' calculation.', 'You can use it in a query like this:', 'You ', ' use the ', ' matchinfo format string here, or you will get incorrect results.', 'An implementation of the ', ' scoring algorithm. Use it in a query like this:', 'You ', ' use the ', ' matchinfo format string here, or you will get incorrect results. If you see any ', ' errors in your logs it may be because you did not use exactly the right format string here.', "SQLite's ", ' returns results as a binary string. This binary represents a list of 32 bit unsigned integers, but reading the binary results is not particularly human-friendly.', 'The ', ' function decodes the binary string and converts it into a JSON list of integers.', 'Usage:', 'Example output:', 'This function decodes the matchinfo document into a verbose JSON structure that describes exactly what each of the returned integers actually means.', 'Full documentation for the different format string options can be found here: ', 'You need to call this function with the same format string as was passed to ', ' - for example:', 'The returned JSON will include a key for each letter in the format string.
